title: Align Industries dropdown labels/routes and replace industry page content in static content registry

requirements.summary: Update “Industries We Serve” dropdown items to exactly match the provided 10 labels and keep links pointing to the corresponding /industries/... routes on both desktop and mobile navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: In the site header, the “Industries We Serve” dropdown shows exactly 10 entries in the exact order and wording provided by the user.
Each dropdown item navigates to the correct existing industry route under /industries/...
On mobile navigation, the same 10 labels appear and navigate correctly.
No other navigation labels are unintentionally changed.

file_operations.description: Update the navigationConfig entry for the 'industries' section so its 10 children labels match the user-provided wording exactly (including singular/plural) while preserving the existing /industries/... paths (notably: change 'Banking & Financial Institutions' → 'Banking & Financial Institution' and 'Training Centers & Skill Development' → 'Training Centers & Skill Development Institutes').

requirements.summary: Replace the content registry entries for the 10 industry pages so each industry route renders the user-provided sections and CTAs using existing ContentPage + ContentRenderer block types.
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to each industry route renders a page with title matching the corresponding dropdown label exactly.

Each industry page includes sections for Headline, Subhead, CTA text, Overview, Core Services (with per-service Benefit lines), Our Delivery Approach, Typical Deployment Locations, Why Choose…, and Next Steps.
CTA links “Request a consultation” and “Get a project proposal” are clickable and route to /contact (hash-router compatible).
No industry page shows the old placeholder/summary content currently present in frontend/src/content/pages.ts for those pageIds.

file_operations.description: For pageIds corporate-enterprise, education, healthcare, manufacturing, government, hospitality, banking, training-centers, retail, and live-events: replace existing placeholder content with the exact user-provided English copy. Set each content.title to exactly the matching dropdown label. Structure sections/blocks in the required order using existing ContentRenderer block types: use a top section containing a prominent 'heading' block for Headline followed by Subhead; represent the CTA as a 'link-list' block with exactly two links labeled “Request a consultation” and “Get a project proposal”, both linking to '/contact'; render Overview as paragraph blocks; render Core Services with per-service sub-headings (use 'heading' blocks) + bullet lists (use 'list' blocks) and render each “Benefit:” line as an 'emphasis' block with style 'bold'; render Our Delivery Approach, Typical Deployment Locations, and the industry-specific “Why … Choose Speedlight” section as 'list' blocks (ensuring the section title matches the user copy exactly); render Next Steps with the closing sentence as a paragraph plus the same two '/contact' CTA links as a 'link-list' block.
